Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior, between glazed lip and lower wall, black-figure decoration consisting of youth in himation (added red with white deposit on top) standing to left.
Curator's comments: There is possibly some white deposit on the cloak. This is a framing figure. For parallels, see Athens, Agora P 4637 in Agora XXIII, pl. 111, no. 1719, dated c. 550-525 BC. See also Agora P 23405 in Agora XXIII, pl. 111, no. 1711, dated c. 540-520 BC.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.26)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 397, no. B582)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0528) (Phase 1)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XIII, no. 6)
